alert.note: Alert for Frazier Mountain Communities; Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Grant Grove Area; Grapevine; Kaiser to Rodgers Ridge; Kern River Valley; Kings Canyon NP; Piute Walker Basin; Sequoia NP; South End of the Lower Sierra; South End of the Upper Sierra; Tehachapi (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 12:04AM PST until February 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches above 4500 feet. Snow amounts of 2 to 4 inches from 3500 feet to 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches from 2500 feet to 3500 feet. * WHERE...The Sierra Nevada and adjacent foothills from Fresno County southward, as well as the Kern County mountains. * WHEN...Valid until 4 PM PST Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Accumulating snow along Interstate 5 over Tejon Pass and along Highway 50 over Tehachapi Pass may result in travel delays and/or road closures. If you plane to travel, consider alternate strategies. If you must travel, allow plenty of time to reach your destination.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
